page.title: 09ALDHAM MILL
page.content: Aldham Mill wasn't a Mill with sails because the wheel turned instead.The river flowing turns the large water wheel,rotating cogs inside which eventually turned the grinding stones. It was used for grain because of all the fields around.It's not used anymore Aldham Mill is no where near Aldham. It was built there because of the river and it could be sold at the market. The staddle stones outside the mill were used for keeping the grain in.The stones had beams on top and a barn was built on top so that the grain could be kept there, without the rats getting at it. There is a house by the mill where the miller would have lived when the mill was used.
